issue.impact: Without this setting enabled the instances can be terminated by accident. This setting should only be used for instances with high availability requirements. Enabling this may prevent IaC workflows from updating the instance, for example terraform will not be able to terminate the instance to update instance type
issue.issue: To prevent instance from being accidentally terminated using Amazon EC2, you can enable termination protection for the instance
issue.title: EC2 API termination protection is not enabled
issue.name: EC2 API termination protection is not enabled

issue.resolve: Set `Properties.KmsKeyId` attribute with customer managed key id
issue.impact: Scope of use of the key cannot be controlled via KMS/IAM policies

remediation.cloudformation: Set `Properties.KmsKeyId` attribute with customer managed key id
remediation.terraform: Set `kms_key_id` attribute with customer managed key id

issue.issue: Log group is not encrypted with customer managed key
issue.title: CloudWatch log group not encrypted with managed key
issue.name: CloudWatch log group not encrypted with managed key

iacDescription.issue: Log group is not encrypted with customer managed key
iacDescription.impact: Scope of use of the key cannot be controlled via KMS/IAM policies
iacDescription.resolve: Set `Properties.KmsKeyId` attribute with customer managed key id

issue.impact: The container may run with outdated or unauthorized image
issue.issue: The image policy does not prevent image reuse
issue.title: Container could be running with outdated image
references: 5.27 Ensure that Docker commands always make use of the latest version of their image
issue.name: Container could be running with outdated image

iacDescription.issue: The image policy does not prevent image reuse
iacDescription.impact: The container may run with outdated or unauthorized image

issue.impact: Compromised process could abuse writable root filesystem to elevate privileges
issue.issue: `readOnlyRootFilesystem` attribute is not set to `true`
issue.title: Container is running with writable root filesystem
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - Ensure that the container's root filesystem is mounted as read only
issue.name: Container is running with writable root filesystem

iacDescription.issue: `readOnlyRootFilesystem` attribute is not set to `true`
iacDescription.impact: Compromised process could abuse writable root filesystem to elevate privileges

issue.impact: AppArmor will not enforce mandatory access control, which can increase the attack vectors.
issue.issue: The AppArmor profile is not set correctly
issue.title: Container is running without AppArmor profile
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.1 Ensure that, if applicable, an AppArmor Profile is enabled
issue.name: Container is running without AppArmor profile

iacDescription.issue: The AppArmor profile is not set correctly
iacDescription.impact: AppArmor will not enforce mandatory access control, which can increase the attack vectors.

issue.impact: Containers without memory limits are more likely to be terminated when the node runs out of memory
issue.issue: Memory limit is not defined
issue.title: Container is running without memory limit
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.10 Ensure that the memory usage for containers is limited
issue.name: Container is running without memory limit

iacDescription.issue: Memory limit is not defined
iacDescription.impact: Containers without memory limits are more likely to be terminated when the node runs out of memory

issue.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value
issue.impact: Containers without limits can exceed the capacity of the node, and affect availability/performance of the host and other containers.
issue.issue: CPU limit is not defined
issue.title: Container is running without cpu limit
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.11 Ensure that CPU priority is set appropriately on containers
issue.name: Container is running without cpu limit

iacDescription.issue: CPU limit is not defined
iacDescription.impact: Containers without limits can exceed the capacity of the node, and affect availability/performance of the host and other containers.
iacDescription.resolve: Add `resources.limits.cpu` field with required CPU limit value

issue.resolve: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`
issue.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying hosts kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).
issue.issue: Container is running in privileged mode
issue.title: Container is running in privileged mode
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.1 Minimize the admission of privileged containers
issue.name: Container is running in privileged mode

iacDescription.issue: Container is running in privileged mode
iacDescription.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying hosts kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).
iacDescription.resolve: Remove `securityContext.privileged` attribute, or set value to `false`

issue.resolve: Set `BlockDeviceMappings.Encrypted` attribute of root device to `true`
issue.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

remediation.cloudformation: Set `BlockDeviceMappings.Encrypted` attribute of root device to `true`

issue.issue: The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted
issue.title: Non-Encrypted root block device
issue.name: Non-Encrypted root block device

iacDescription.issue: The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted
iacDescription.impact: That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.
iacDescription.resolve: Set `BlockDeviceMappings.Encrypted` attribute of root device to `true`

issue.impact: Container could be running with full administrative privileges
issue.issue: Container is running without root user control
issue.title: Container is running without root user control
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.5 Ensure sensitive host system directories are not mounted on containers
issue.name: Container is running without root user control

iacDescription.issue: Container is running without root user control
iacDescription.impact: Container could be running with full administrative privileges

issue.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`
issue.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
issue.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
issue.title: Container does not drop all default capabilities
issue.name: Container does not drop all default capabilities

iacDescription.issue: All default capabilities are not explicitly dropped
iacDescription.impact: Containers are running with potentially unnecessary privileges
iacDescription.resolve: Add `ALL` to `securityContext.capabilities.drop` list, and add only required capabilities in `securityContext.capabilities.add`

issue.impact: Processes could elevate current privileges via known vectors, for example SUID binaries
issue.issue: `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute is not set to `false`
issue.title: Container is running without privilege escalation control
references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.25 Ensure that the container is restricted from acquiring additional privileges
issue.name: Container is running without privilege escalation control

iacDescription.issue: `allowPrivilegeEscalation` attribute is not set to `false`
iacDescription.impact: Processes could elevate current privileges via known vectors, for example SUID binaries
